I have created a scatter plot using seaborn with the following code:

```python
import seaborn as sns
sns.set(style="ticks", color_codes=True)
        
g=sns.scatterplot(x="length", y="coverage", data=df, hue = 'Products', edgecolors=None, alpha = 0.7)
g.set(yscale="log")
plt.xlabel("Length(bp)")
plt.ylabel("Coverage")
plt.legend(loc = 'lower right')
plt.savefig('ATN_plot.png',dpi = 600)
```

The data I'm using is partially like this:

The resultant scatter plot has white edges around the spots which I don't want. I've tried using `edgecolors=None` but it hasn't worked. How can I either remove the edge color or change it to something else?

To remove the white edges around the markers in your scatter plot, you can adjust the `edgecolor` parameter in the `sns.scatterplot` function. Setting `edgecolor='none'` should effectively remove the edges. However, if this doesn't work as expected, you can also try setting the `linewidth` to zero, which can help eliminate the appearance of edges. Here's how you can modify your code:

```python
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

sns.set(style="ticks", color_codes=True)

# Create the scatter plot
g = sns.scatterplot(
    x="length", y="coverage", data=df, hue='Products',
    edgecolor='none', alpha=0.7, linewidth=0
)

# Set y-axis to log scale
g.set(yscale="log")

# Set the labels
plt.xlabel("Length(bp)")
plt.ylabel("Coverage")

# Place the legend in the lower right
plt.legend(loc='lower right')

# Save the plot with high resolution
plt.savefig('ATN_plot.png', dpi=600)
```

If you still encounter any issues, make sure that your seaborn and matplotlib packages are up-to-date, as there may have been updates or changes in the parameter handling. You can update them using pip:

```bash
pip install --upgrade seaborn matplotlib
```

This should help you achieve a cleaner look for your scatter plot without unwanted edge colors.
